channel.title: C++ on Portfolio - Preston Locke
channel.description: Recent content in C++ on Portfolio - Preston Locke

item.title: Password Manager
item.description: A partner and I created this application for our Computer Security and Privacy course as our final project. The goal was to implement a basic password manager that could properly encrypt/decrypt information, as well as provide feedback to the user about the strength of each password. I implemented most of the functionality, including data storage and encryption, as well as the optimized algorithm for checking passwords against pre-existing dictionaries of insecure passwords.

item.title: QNotPad
item.description: Using the Qt framework, I wrote a simple GUI text editor in C++, modeled after Notepad on Windows.

item.title: CPUID
item.description: Using C++ code that interfaces with hand-written Assembly, I wrote a terminal application that reads the info about your CPU using the CPUID Assembly instruction.
